edu.rit.se.swen383.audio

Class AudioPlayer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • edu.rit.se.swen383.audio.AudioPlayer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class AudioPlayer
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.lang.Runnable
    The Player class implements a simple player for playback of an MPEG audio stream in a separate thread.
    Based on the original player from the javazoom library by Mat McGowan.

    • Method Detail

      • getPlayer

        public static AudioPlayer getPlayer()
        Static factory to return the unique (singleton) instance. The Player is also started in its own thread.
        Returns:
        the singleton AudioPlayer object.

      • playMP3

        public boolean playMP3(java.lang.String filename)
                throws java.lang.Exception
        Start playing an MP3 file.
        • If playing starts while another stream is in progress and switching is possible, the current stream is terminated and the player switches to the new file.
        • If a file plays to completion, any Observers are notified via calls to their update() methods - this allows an Observer to automatically start playing a new file.
        Parameters:
        filename - Name of the file containing an MP3 stream.
        Returns:
        true if the file could be played immediately, false if it cannot be played at this time.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - If the file cannot be played for some reason (e.g., malformed MP3 data).

      • getPosition

        public int getPosition()
        Retrieves the time position (in milliseconds) of the audio stream being played.
        Returns:
        stream position in milliseconds.

      • pause

        public boolean pause()
        Pause the player if playing.
        Returns:
        true iff the player changed state to paused.

      • resume

        public boolean resume()
        Resume playing if the player is paused.
        Returns:
        true iff the player changed state to playing.

      • run

        public void run()
        The run method called by the surrounding Thread. Basically wait for something to play and then play it.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
